name: Branch Manager
description: Responsible for overall branch operations, team management, and meeting business targets.
responsibilities: Oversee daily operations and ensure compliance with company standards
Manage staff scheduling, training, and performance evaluations
Monitor KPIs including sales targets, waste percentages, and hygiene scores
Ensure inventory management and ordering processes
Conduct daily briefings and team meetings

morning.hint: Check security log and alarm system
Check against purchase order, verify quality and temperature
Review daily specials, stock issues, and assign tasks
Count and sign off on till float with counter staff

preLunch.hint: Check all stations, cleanliness, and food safety compliance

preLunch.action: Review morning sales and adjust prep
preLunch.hint: Compare to forecast, communicate with kitchen

service.hint: Floor presence, customer interaction, resolve issues
Ensure adequate staffing, speed of service, stock levels

postLunch.hint: Update daily sales sheet, compare to target

closeout.hint: Count tills, match receipts, complete daily banking
Verify all stations closed properly, sign off
Set alarm, lock all doors, complete security log

opening.task: Unlock and disarm security system
Verify all refrigeration units at correct temperature (0-4°C)
Check staff attendance and adjust assignments if needed
Review delivery schedule for today
Count and verify cash float (AED 500)
Check POS system is operational
Review previous day's incident log
Conduct brief team huddle (5 mins)

service.task: Check food presentation standards at counter
Interact with minimum 10 customers for feedback
Verify staff are following hygiene protocols
Check stock levels and communicate needs to kitchen
Document any customer complaints in log

closing.task: Complete cash reconciliation and variance report
Review and sign off waste log
Verify all cleaning logs completed and signed
Check all equipment turned off except refrigeration
Update daily sales report and send to head office
Lock all cash in safe
Complete incident log (if any incidents occurred)
Set alarm and secure all entry points
Send end-of-day WhatsApp to ops manager

dos: Lead by example with uniform and hygiene standards
Communicate clearly and respectfully with all staff
Address issues immediately and document properly
Celebrate team successes and individual achievements
Maintain visible presence during peak service times
donts: Never compromise on food safety standards
Don't ignore customer complaints or feedback
Avoid favoritism among team members
Don't skip daily cash reconciliation
Never leave branch unattended during operating hours

name: Operations Supervisor
description: Supports branch manager in daily operations, coordinates between kitchen and counter teams.
responsibilities: Supervise food preparation and service standards
Coordinate between kitchen and counter staff
Conduct quality checks throughout the day
Monitor food safety and hygiene compliance
Handle customer service during peak times

morning.hint: Check temperatures, verify quantities, organize storage
Monitor food prep sequence, check portion sizes

preLunch.hint: Check all food displays, temperatures, labeling
Review specials, stock availability, assign positions

service.hint: Float between kitchen and counter, resolve bottlenecks

postLunch.hint: Count inventory, prepare order list for manager

opening.task: Verify all food items properly labeled with prep date
Check kitchen equipment is clean and operational
Review today's prep list with kitchen staff
Ensure adequate stock of packaging materials
Verify allergen information displayed correctly
Check all staff have clean uniforms and name tags

service.task: Ensure FIFO (First In, First Out) being followed
Communicate stock shortages to manager immediately
Assist with queue management during rush

closing.task: Supervise proper food storage procedures
Verify waste log is accurate and complete
Check all food items are covered and dated
Ensure cleaning schedule followed by all staff
Review next day's prep requirements
Sign off on all department closing checklists

dos: Maintain consistent quality standards across all shifts
Provide constructive feedback to team members
Act quickly on food safety concerns
Document all quality issues and resolutions
Support staff development through on-job training
donts: Don't overlook small hygiene violations
Never rush food safety procedures
Avoid being stationed in one area only
Don't ignore equipment maintenance needs
Never serve food that doesn't meet standards

name: Kitchen Staff
description: Responsible for food preparation, cooking, and maintaining kitchen hygiene standards.
responsibilities: Prepare food items according to standardized recipes
Maintain cleanliness and organization of kitchen
Follow food safety and HACCP guidelines
Minimize food waste through proper portioning

morning.hint: Turn on equipment, check temperatures, organize stations
Follow daily prep list, label everything with date/time

preLunch.hint: Cook hot meals, prepare salads, portion snacks
Complete all items, get supervisor approval

service.hint: Monitor stock at counter, prepare additional items as needed

postLunch.hint: Log waste, clean all surfaces and equipment

closeout.hint: Store food properly, turn off equipment, final clean

opening.task: Wash hands thoroughly and put on clean uniform
Check all refrigerators at 0-4°C, freezers at -18°C
Verify delivery items for quality and temperature
Store delivery items properly with date labels
Check expiry dates on all ingredients
Set up work stations with required tools and ingredients
Update allergen information board
Get supervisor sign-off on opening checklist by 10:00 AM

service.task: Label all prepared items with date and time
Keep raw and cooked foods separated
Monitor and replenish counter stock levels

closing.task: Complete waste log with photos
Store all food items properly labeled and covered
Clean and sanitize all work surfaces
Clean cooking equipment and appliances
Sweep and mop kitchen floors
Empty and clean all trash bins
Turn off all equipment except refrigeration
Complete cleaning log with supervisor signature
Organize prep list for next day

dos: Always taste food before service to ensure quality
Follow recipes exactly for consistency
Inform supervisor of any equipment issues immediately
Use proper knife techniques to avoid injury
Rotate stock using FIFO method
Keep work area organized and clean
donts: Never work with food if feeling unwell
Don't reuse gloves between different tasks
Avoid cross-contamination of allergens
Don't leave food at room temperature > 2 hours
Never taste food with cooking utensils
Don't skip temperature checks

name: Counter Staff
description: Front-line customer service, food display management, and point-of-sale operations.
responsibilities: Follow food safety protocols at service counter
Answer customer questions about menu items

morning.hint: Set up display units, test POS, organize packaging
Follow planogram, check temperatures, arrange attractively

preLunch.hint: Count cash float, refresh displays, clean glass

service.hint: Serve customers, maintain displays, keep area clean

postLunch.hint: Clean displays, wipe surfaces, organize stock

closeout.hint: Count cash, complete Z-report, clean thoroughly

opening.task: Wash hands and wear clean uniform with name tag
Clean and sanitize all counter surfaces
Set up display following planogram
Check all display units at correct temperature
Test POS system with test transaction
Count and verify cash float with manager (AED 500)
Stock packaging materials and utensils
Display allergen information and menu boards
Review today's specials and prices

service.task: Greet every customer with a smile
Use tongs/gloves for all food handling
Keep work area clean and organized
Handle cash accurately and provide receipts

closing.task: Complete Z-report on POS system
Count cash and complete reconciliation form
Return leftover food to kitchen with waste log
Clean all display cases inside and out
Wipe down counter, POS, and customer areas
Restock packaging for next day
Take photo of clean counter area
Get manager sign-off on closing checklist

dos: Always acknowledge customers immediately
Upsell specials and combo deals politely
Keep displays looking fresh and appetizing
Handle customer complaints professionally
Maintain positive attitude during rush periods
Thank every customer
donts: Never handle food and cash without washing hands
Don't engage in personal conversations during service
Avoid showing frustration with difficult customers
Don't leave cash drawer open unattended
Never serve food past hold times
Don't give unauthorized discounts

name: Cleaning Staff
description: Maintains hygiene standards throughout the branch, including dining area, restrooms, and back-of-house.
responsibilities: Maintain cleanliness of dining and service areas
Mop and sanitize floors throughout the day
Restock cleaning supplies and restroom items

morning.hint: Dining area, restrooms, entrance - ready for students
Check soap, paper towels, toilet paper

preLunch.hint: Touch-up high traffic areas, empty bins

service.hint: Clear tables, mop spills, manage waste, clean restrooms every 30 mins

closeout.hint: Deep clean, take out trash, mop all floors

opening.task: Sweep and mop dining area floors
Clean and sanitize all tables and chairs
Clean restrooms completely (toilets, sinks, mirrors)
Restock restroom supplies (soap, paper, sanitizer)
Empty and line all waste bins
Clean entrance doors and glass
Prepare cleaning station with supplies

service.task: Clear and clean tables immediately after use
Wipe food service counter glass regularly
Sanitize door handles and high-touch surfaces

closing.task: Deep clean all dining tables and chairs
Thoroughly mop all floor areas
Complete restroom deep clean and restock
Remove all trash to external bins
Clean and organize cleaning storage area
Sanitize all high-touch surfaces
Take photos of clean dining area and restrooms
Complete cleaning log and get supervisor sign-off
Prepare cleaning checklist for next day

dos: Use proper dilution ratios for cleaning chemicals
Wear appropriate PPE (gloves, appropriate footwear)
Place wet floor signs when mopping
Report maintenance issues immediately
Smile and greet students and staff
Keep cleaning cart organized and stocked
donts: Never mix different cleaning chemicals
Don't leave cleaning supplies unattended
Avoid cleaning during peak rush if possible
Don't use worn out or dirty cleaning cloths
Never block emergency exits with equipment
Don't skip hand sanitizing between areas
